issues.description: The prose sections (Abstract, Corpus Design) of `experiment.md` state the corpus contains 6 speeches, but the machine-readable appendix of the same file specifies `sample_size: 7`. The `corpus.md` manifest also correctly lists 7 documents.
issues.impact: This inconsistency can lead to confusion when interpreting the research design and results, as the narrative description of the sample size conflicts with the actual data being processed. It undermines the clarity of the experimental documentation.
issues.fix: Update the narrative sections (Abstract, Corpus Design) in `experiment.md` to reflect the correct sample size of 7 documents, ensuring consistency with the machine-readable appendix and the corpus manifest.

issues.description: The prose in the `corpus.md` overview states the analysis uses "the Cohesive Flourishing Framework v10.0", but the experiment is configured to use `framework.md`, which is specified as version 10.4.
issues.impact: This is a minor documentation inconsistency that could cause confusion about which specific version of the framework's definitions and calculations are being applied.
issues.fix: Update the overview prose in `corpus.md` to reference "Cohesive Flourishing Framework v10.4" to ensure it matches the actual framework file being used in the experiment.
